articles.headline: Justice Dept. Approves Disney’s Purchase of Fox Assets
articles.snippet: The decision would require Disney, which already owns ESPN, to divest 22 regional sports networks.
articles.abstract: The decision would require Disney, which already owns ESPN, to divest 22 regional sports networks.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Department of Justice approved the Walt Disney Company’s $71 billion bid for the entertainment assets of 21st Century Fox on Wednesday, potentially complicating Comcast’s desire to make a rival offer for Rupert Murdoch’s entertainment empire.
articles.byline: By Edmund Lee and Cecilia Kang

articles.headline: Supreme Court Justice Anthony Kennedy Will Retire
articles.snippet: The announcement gives President Trump the opportunity to create a solid five-member conservative majority and fundamentally change the direction of the court.
articles.abstract: The announcement gives President Trump the opportunity to create a solid five-member conservative majority and fundamentally change the direction of the court.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Justice Anthony M. Kennedy announced on Wednesday that he would retire this summer, setting in motion a furious fight over the future of the Supreme Court and giving President Trump the chance to put a conservative stamp on the American legal system for generations.

articles.headline: With Jobs to Fill, Businesses Play the Visa Lottery
articles.snippet: A tight labor market set off a scramble among businesses in a visa lottery for temporary workers, adding a new element to the politics of immigration.
articles.abstract: A tight labor market set off a scramble among businesses in a visa lottery for temporary workers, adding a new element to the politics of immigration.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ronda Fox finally got the news last week, three months into planting season: The federal government approved her application to employ more than a dozen temporary foreign workers for her family-owned landscaping business in Aurora, Colo.

articles.headline: In Influence if Not in Title, This Has Been the Kennedy Court
articles.snippet: Justice Anthony M. Kennedy occupied a place at the court’s ideological center for his entire tenure, with his vote often the crucial one in closely divided cases.
articles.abstract: Justice Anthony M. Kennedy occupied a place at the court’s ideological center for his entire tenure, with his vote often the crucial one in closely divided cases.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Justice Anthony M. Kennedy has served for more than 30 years under two chief justices: William H. Rehnquist and John G. Roberts Jr. Courts are by tradition named for the chief justice. Since 2005, it has been the Roberts court.

articles.headline: Anthony Kennedy’s Exit May Echo for Generations
articles.snippet: Despite President Trump’s rocky tenure, his opportunity to reshape the Supreme Court may allow him to go down in history as an unusually influential president.
articles.abstract: Despite President Trump’s rocky tenure, his opportunity to reshape the Supreme Court may allow him to go down in history as an unusually influential president.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump’s time in office has been tumultuous, his term dogged by the special counsel investigation, his major legislative achievements few and his political prospects clouded by the chances of a Democratic Party midterm wave.

articles.headline: Demystifying the Blockchain
articles.snippet: Slowly and unsteadily, the mysterious blockchain is emerging from the shadows and making its way into a still murky future. Don’t count it out.
articles.abstract: Slowly and unsteadily, the mysterious blockchain is emerging from the shadows and making its way into a still murky future. Don’t count it out.

articles.headline: Amazon to Buy Online Pharmacy PillPack, Jumping Into the Drug Business
articles.snippet: The purchase of PillPack, an online pharmacy, is the latest sign of Amazon’s increasing interest in health care.
articles.abstract: The purchase of PillPack, an online pharmacy, is the latest sign of Amazon’s increasing interest in health care.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the world of health care, PillPack, an online pharmacy, is a pretty small player. Its work force of 1,000 or so people pales in comparison with the 235,000 who work for Walgreens.
articles.byline: By Claire Ballentine and Katie Thomas

articles.headline: Political War Over Replacing Kennedy on Supreme Court Is Underway
articles.snippet: Democrats and liberal advocacy organizations face enormous challenges if they hope to prevent President Trump from installing a conservative justice.
articles.abstract: Democrats and liberal advocacy organizations face enormous challenges if they hope to prevent President Trump from installing a conservative justice.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A political war over replacing  Justice Anthony M. Kennedy roared to life on Thursday in Washington, the start of an election-season clash over a Supreme Court retirement that will reshape the country’s judicial future.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Thomas Kaplan
